document_data.name: Scratch
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/60/More Cantrips: Mini-spells for apprentice magic-users|17}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Scratch''''' was a person-affecting [[cantrip]] that [[wizard]]s-in-training could learn.{{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|6}} It caused a target creature to experience an irritating itch they felt compelled to relieve.
document_data.Effects: This cantrip could target a single creature within {{SI|30|ft|long=yes}} and caused a spot on their body to become irritated, as if they had a rash or had been bitten by an insect. If the target did not resist the spell, they immediately moved to relive the itch by rubbing the spot with their nails, claws, or whatever method was effective for the creature. One second of scratching was all it took to alleviate the discomfort.
document_data.Components: This cantrip required [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s to cast. The caster spoke the name of a skin pest (flea, [[louse]], tick, ''etc.'') while pointing to a spot on the target creature.
